post: üßµI will say it again: Much of Venezuela‚Äôs oil is very heavy crude that's high in sulfur and metals and has a low API gravity, which makes it difficult and expensive to refine. You need a lot of expensive catalysts to get rid of the sulfur.

It's not about the Venezuelan oil. To get prospecting, drilling and refining up to speed could take 5 years or more, and would only be profitable if oil prices are very high. No US oil company has shown any interest. With renewables taking over, this smells more like another Epstein distraction.
